project_data.description: A dictionary containing the updated project details. This dictionary must include an 'id' field, and its string representation must match the project ID provided in the path.

type_id.description: The string identifier for the object's type.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the project. This identifier must match the string representation of the project's unique internal identifier provided in the function's `id` parameter.

external_id.description: A string that serves as the project's external identifier.

supplier_companies.description: A list of supplier company objects, with each object structured as a dictionary with string keys.

supplier_contacts.description: A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents a supplier contact.

status.description: A string indicating the current status of the project.

attributes.description: A dictionary containing various descriptive and operational attributes for the project. It includes fields such as `name` (string), `description` (string), `state` (string, with defined values like 'draft' or 'active'), date fields like `target_start_date`, financial details like `actual_spend_amount` (float), and boolean flags such as `needs_attention`.

relationships.description: A dictionary that defines the project's various relationships. It includes `attachments` (an array of attachment objects), `creator` (a project creator stakeholder object), `requester` (a project requester stakeholder object), `owner` (a project owner stakeholder object), and `project_type` (a project type object).

name: update_spend_category_by_id
description: Update an existing spend category using its unique identifier. This identifier must match the ID provided in the path. Only the attributes specified in the payload will be updated; other attributes remain unchanged.

external_id.description: A unique string identifier for the spend category to be updated.

name.description: The optional name for the spend category. It must not exceed 255 characters.

new_external_id.description: An optional external system ID, limited to a maximum length of 255 characters.

usages.description: Optional. A list of applicable contexts, where each context must be one of: "procurement", "expense", "ad_hoc_payment", or "supplier_invoice".

name: update_spend_category_details_by_external_id
description: Updates the details of an existing spend category using its internal identifier, which must match the one provided in the URL path. All parameters for the update are optional, and only the provided fields will be modified.

id.description: The internal integer identifier for the spend category to be updated. This ID must match the one provided in the URL path.

name.description: Specifies the updated name for the spend category, with a maximum length of 255 characters.

external_id.description: An external identifier for the spend category. This value can be new or the same as the existing one, and it must not exceed 255 characters.

usages.description: An updated list of usages for the spend category. Each usage in the list must be one of the following allowed values: 'procurement', 'expense', 'ad_hoc_payment', or 'supplier_invoice'.

name: update_supplier_company_by_external_id
description: Updates an existing supplier company identified by its external ID. The request body must include an `id` that matches the external identifier provided in the path.

external_id.description: The required external identifier for the supplier company. For example: `1234-5678-abcd-efgh`.

_include.description: A comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response. Accepted values are `attachments`, `supplier_category`, `supplier_groups`, `default_payment_term`, `payment_types`, `default_payment_type`, `payment_currencies`, `default_payment_currency`, and `supplier_classification_values`.

type.description: The type of resource, which must be the string `supplier_companies`.

id.description: The identifier for the supplier company.

attributes.description: An object containing the supplier company attributes to update.

name.description: The required name of the company, with a maximum length of 255 characters.

description.description: An optional description of the supplier company.

public.description: Controls the public visibility of the company's profile. A value of `true` makes the company visible to the public, while a value of `false` keeps it private.

risk.description: A unique, human-readable identifier (slug) that represents the company's risk level.

segmentation.description: The unique, human-readable identifier (slug) used for segmenting the supplier company.

segmentation_status.description: A URL-friendly string (slug) that represents the segmentation status. A slug is typically lowercase and uses hyphens to separate words.

segmentation_notes.description: Additional notes or comments regarding the segmentation of the supplier company.

tags.description: A collection of tags used to classify the supplier company.

url.description: The complete URL of the supplier's website.

duns_number.description: A unique nine-digit Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S) number that identifies the company.

external_id.description: A custom identifier used to reference the supplier company in an external system.

self_registered.description: Indicates whether the supplier completed the registration process themselves.

onboarding_form_completion_status.description: The completion status of the supplier's onboarding form. The value must be one of the following: `null`, `not_started`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

accept_all_currencies.description: Specifies whether the supplier accepts all currencies.

name.description: Name of the custom field.

custom_fields.description: A list of custom fields to be applied to the supplier company.

relationships.description: An object for updating linked resources, where each resource can be specified by either an internal ID (e.g., `supplier_category`) or an external ID (e.g., `external_supplier_category`). It supports single-item relationships like `default_payment_term` as a dictionary and multi-item relationships like `supplier_groups` as a list of dictionaries.

attachments.description: A resource identifier object that specifies the attachments to be linked. This object must contain the attachment's unique identifier (`id`) and a `type` attribute with the literal string value "attachments".

body.description: An object containing the fields and values to update for a supplier company.

name: update_supplier_company_by_id
description: Updates the attributes and relationships of an existing supplier company. The request body must contain the unique identifier for the supplier, which must match the ID in the path. Note that when updating relationships, the entire existing relationship is replaced by the provided values.

id.description: The required, unique identifier for the supplier company. For example: `1`.

_include.description: Specifies related resources to include in the response, provided as a comma-separated list. Allowed values are `attachments`, `supplier_category`, `supplier_groups`, `default_payment_term`, `payment_types`, `default_payment_type`, `payment_currencies`, `default_payment_currency`, and `supplier_classification_values`.

type.description: The type of resource, which must be the string `supplier_companies`.

id.description: The unique identifier for the supplier company. This value must exactly match the company ID specified in the request's URL path.

name.description: The required name for the supplier, which cannot exceed 255 characters.

description.description: A description of the supplier company.

public.description: Indicates whether the company is publicly listed.

risk.description: A unique slug representing a risk classification, which must be a value pre-defined by your organization.

segmentation.description: The unique, URL-friendly identifier (slug) for the company's segmentation.

segmentation_status.description: A unique, URL-friendly identifier (slug) for the segmentation status.

segmentation_notes.description: Specifies any additional notes or comments related to the supplier company's segmentation.

tags.description: A collection of tags to be assigned to the supplier.

url.description: The URL of the supplier's website.

duns_number.description: The company's unique nine-digit Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S) number.

external_id.description: The unique identifier for the supplier as defined in your internal system.

onboarding_form_completion_status.description: The completion status of the supplier's onboarding form. Must be one of the following values: `null`, `not_started`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

accept_all_currencies.description: A boolean flag specifying if the supplier accepts all currencies (`true`) or if acceptance is restricted (`false`).

custom_fields.description: A list of custom field entries, where each entry must be one of the following supported types: Checkbox, Short Text, Paragraph, Date, Integer, Currency, Decimal, Single Select, Multiple Select, URL, Lookup, or Related. Please note that file-type custom fields are not accessible through the API and return `null`.

relationships.description: An object containing supplier relationship data that replaces all existing relationship information. This object can include fields for `supplier_category`, `supplier_groups`, payment details, `attachments`, and `supplier_classification_values`.

body.description: A `SupplierCompanyUpdate` object that contains the fields and values to update for an existing supplier company.

name: update_supplier_company_contact_by_id
description: Updates the details of an existing supplier company contact. This function allows modification of contact information by providing updated values for specific fields, with the contact identified by both company ID and contact ID.

company_id.description: The unique integer identifier for a supplier company. This ID is used by the system to reference the company.

contact_id.description: The unique integer identifier for the contact. This internal ID is used by the system to reference the contact.

_include.description: A comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response; however, this functionality is not fully implemented in the simulation.

name.description: The contact's full name, provided as a string.

email.description: Specifies the contact's email address as a string.

role.description: Specifies the contact's role within the company.

status.description: The current status of the contact.

body.description: A dictionary specifying the fields to update for the contact. It must contain at least one field, which can include "name", "email", "phone", "role", "status", or other contact-specific fields.

name: update_supplier_contact_by_external_id
description: Updates the attributes and relationships, such as contact types and phone numbers, for an existing supplier contact identified by its external ID. The request body must include the contact's internal `id`, which must match the contact's identifier in the system.

external_id.description: A required and unique external identifier for the supplier contact. For example: `CNT-17`.

_include.description: A comma-separated string of related resources to include in the response. Allowed values are `supplier_company`, `contact_types`, and `phones`.

type.description: The type of resource. This field is required and must have the value "supplier_contacts".

id.description: The required internal identifier for the contact. This value must match the ID of the contact record being updated.

name.description: The full name of the contact, with a maximum length of 255 characters. This parameter is required unless both `first_name` and `last_name` are provided.

first_name.description: The first name of the contact, with a maximum length of 255 characters.

last_name.description: The last name, which cannot exceed 255 characters.

email.description: A required email address, which cannot exceed 255 characters.

notes.description: Any optional notes or supplemental information about the contact.

phone_number.description: **DEPRECATED.** This property is deprecated; use the `phones` relationship instead.

job_title.description: The job title of the contact.

external_id.description: A unique identifier for the contact, assigned by or used in an external system.

is_suggested.description: Indicates that the contact is a suggestion that has not yet been approved.

contact_types.description: A list of objects representing contact types, where each object must include an integer `id` and a string `type`.

phones.description: A list of resource identifier objects for the associated phones. Each object must contain an `id` as an integer and a `type` as a string.

body.description: An object that contains the updated contact details for the supplier.

name: update_supplier_contact_by_id
description: Updates the details of an existing supplier contact, with the option to modify related contact types and phone records. The request body must include the contact `id`, which is required to match the `id` provided in the path parameter.

id.description: The required and unique identifier for the supplier contact to be updated.

_include.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response. Allowed values are `supplier_company`, `contact_types`, and `phones`.

type.description: Specifies the resource type. This field is required and must have the value `supplier_contacts`.

id.description: The unique identifier for the supplier contact. This value is required and must match the `id` provided in the URL path.

name.description: The contact's full name, with a maximum length of 255 characters. This parameter is required unless both `first_name` and `last_name` are provided.

first_name.description: The first name, which cannot exceed 255 characters.

last_name.description: The last name of the supplier contact, which cannot exceed 255 characters.

email.description: A required email address for the supplier contact, which must not exceed 255 characters.

notes.description: Additional information or comments about the supplier contact.

phone_number.description: This field is deprecated. Use the `phones` relationship instead.

job_title.description: The job title of the contact.

external_id.description: A unique identifier from an external system used to reference the supplier contact.

is_suggested.description: Indicates whether the contact is considered suggested or unapproved.

contact_types.description: A list of resource identifier objects for the contact types. Each object must contain an integer `id` and a string `type`.

phones.description: A list of resource identifier objects. Each object must contain an integer `id` and a string `type`.

body.description: A data payload containing the updated contact information for the supplier.
